name: Coin Partitions
description:
let P(n) be a function that represents the number of ways that n coins can be partitioned. For example, 5 coins can be partitioned in seven different ways:
ooooo
oooo o
ooo oo
ooo o o
oo oo o
oo o o o
o o o o o

You will be given an N such that N is less than 30. Print p(N).
